notesStmt.note: Folios 1 and 9 largely illegible through damp.

Folios 232-233 were previously bound with another volume (Add. 17050). Shemu᾿el de Modena, dated 1653, Verona: inscribed in a record of death: folio 234v. Camillo Jaghel: inscribed with his name, 1613 (folio 231v); see 50-56. Fra Giro[lamo] de Durazzano de Predi[?]: censor's signature and note 1640 (folio 231v). (Narkiss reads the name Durallano), on him see 89. Laurentius Franguellus (fl. until 1596): inscribed with his name, 1575 (folios 231v, 233v); see 78, appendix § 105-110. Renatus a Mutina: insribed with his name, 1621 (folio 231v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Isaac Alfasi's commentary on some tractates of the Talmud. Contains the commentary of Rashi and additional glosses from Tosafot, Mordekhai and others on the margins.

msItem.title: Discussions and decisions on the tractate Ḥulin

collation.p: 28 complete quires: i-xvi8 (folios 2-209), separate folio 210, xxvii-xviii6 (folios 219-230), folios 231-234 (additions). Quires enumerated with Hebrew letters, cut away in the trimming.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square and semi-cursive script of the 14th century. Shemayah: inscribed with his name in the colophon, folio 210v. Written for Mosheh ben Yosef: inscribed, folio 210.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Alfasi Halakhot with Commentaries. Hebrew. Vol. I. Brit. Mus. Additional 17,049.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Thomas Rodd the younger (b. 1796, d. 1849): purchased from him by the British Museum on 23 October 1847 (Macdonald's sale, lot 157): inscribed, [235v].
